intro: Tetranthera macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered tetranthera, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruits are follicles that release seeds when mature. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
